meanings.definition: Short parallel lines used in mapmaking to indicate relief
meanings.sent1: The mapmaker added hachures to show the mountainous areas.
meanings.sent2: The hachures on the map helped me understand the terrain better.
meanings.sent3: The hachures on the map looked like tiny ladders climbing up the page.
meanings.sent4: The hachures on the map were like nature's fingerprints, revealing its secrets.
meanings.sent5: The hachures on the map made the landscape come alive before my eyes.

meanings.definition: A method of shading in drawing or engraving using short lines
meanings.sent1: The artist used hachures to create depth in the sketch.
meanings.sent2: Hachures are essential for adding texture to the drawing.
meanings.sent3: The hachures in the artwork made the characters look like they were moving.
meanings.sent4: Her use of hachures was like a secret code, adding layers of meaning to the image.
meanings.sent5: The hachures in the drawing made the scene feel three-dimensional.

meanings.definition: A series of short lines used in architectural drafting to show the slope of a surface
meanings.sent1: The architect carefully added hachures to represent the hill's incline.
meanings.sent2: Hachures are crucial for illustrating the gradient of the land.
meanings.sent3: The hachures on the blueprint made the building look like it was sliding downhill.
meanings.sent4: The hachures on the plan were like arrows pointing towards the sloping terrain.
meanings.sent5: The hachures on the blueprint brought the design to life, showing its contours.
